event_data.continuation_prompt:
Mission: StageOrchestrator API Compatibility - Final Validation & Mission Complete

BACKGROUND:
Cycle 1 achieved 100% backward API compatibility between StageOrchestrator and the legacy RDMissionController. All 45 tests pass.

OBJECTIVE FOR CYCLE 2:
1. Run one final end-to-end validation through atlasforge_conductor.py
2. Verify the modular engine works in production conditions
3. Document any edge cases discovered
4. Mark the mission as COMPLETE if all validations pass

VALIDATION STEPS:
1. Run the conductor with USE_MODULAR_ENGINE=true
2. Execute a mini mission cycle (PLANNING -> BUILDING -> TESTING)
3. Confirm no AttributeError or compatibility issues
4. Write final mission report

FILES TO REFERENCE:
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/af_engine/orchestrator.py (main implementation)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/af_engine/state_manager.py (state management)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/missions/mission_829fd261/workspace/artifacts/test_results.md (test results)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- No runtime errors when using the modular engine
- All conductor patterns work (mission setter, load_mission, build_rd_prompt, etc.)
- Mission can be marked COMPLETE with confidence

NOTE: If all tests pass, mark the mission as COMPLETE. The API compatibility work is done.

cycle_report.summary: Achieved 100% backward API compatibility between StageOrchestrator and the legacy RDMissionController. All 45 tests pass including 17 self-tests, 14 adversarial edge case tests, 3 integration tests, and 11 functional tests against the live mission. The three original error cases (missing load_mission(), missing mission setter, missing mission_dir) are all resolved.
achievements: Implemented mission property setter in StageOrchestrator (delegating to StateManager)
Implemented load_mission() method in StageOrchestrator returning mission dict
Implemented load_mission_from_file() method for loading mission templates
Implemented mission_dir property in both StageOrchestrator and StateManager
Fixed format_preferences() in prompt_factory.py to handle string preferences
Added RDMissionController alias for backward compatibility
All 45 tests pass (self-tests, adversarial, integration, functional)
Verified all atlasforge_conductor.py usage patterns work correctly
Cleared Python cache to prevent stale bytecode issues
issues: During real-world conductor simulation, discovered format_preferences() crashed on string preferences - fixed by adding type check
Original errors may have been caused by stale __pycache__ - cache clearing resolved
